clinical_study.brief_title: Continuous Endotracheal Cuff Pressure Control to Prevent Ventilator Associated Respiratory Infections
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Continuous Endotracheal Cuff Pressure Control for the Prevention of Ventilator Associated Respiratory Infections

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine whether automated cuff pressure control results in a reduction in the proportion of patients developing ventilator associated respiratory infections during their stay in intensive care.

detailed_description.textblock:
The proposed study is a randomized controlled trial of tracheal cuff pressure control using continuous control via an automated electronic device as compared with intermittent pressure control for the prevention of ventilator associated respiratory infection in ICU.
The study will be conducted at multiple sites in Vietnam. Recruitment will be for 18 months at all centers. Patients experiencing any hospital acquired infection whilst at risk of Ventilator Associated Respiratory Infections will be evaluated in using a standardised investigation protocol to identify cases of VARI and other hospital acquired infections (HAI)s. Assessment of VARI will be based on published criteria and carried out by an endpoint review committee independent of patient care and blinded to the allocation of the patient. Antibiotic use data and duration of stay will be important secondary outcome measures.

primary_outcome.measure: Ventilator Associated Respiratory Infection (VARI) - defined as Ventilator Associated Pneumonia (VAP) or Ventilator Associated Tracheobronchitis (VAT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomisation to ICU discharge/death/transfer or 90 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbiologically confirmed VARI defined as above plus bacterial growth of ≥105 cfu/ml (ETA) or equivalent semi-quantitative for both VAP and VAT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomisation to ICU discharge/death/transfer or 90 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical and microbiologically confirmed VAP (see above for definitions)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomisation to ICU discharge/death/transfer or 90 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Total number of days ventilated/in ICU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomisation to ICU discharge, death, transfer or 90 days
From ICU admission to ICU discharge, death, transfer or 90 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost of antibiotics in ICU stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From ICU admission to ICU discharge, death, transfer or 90 days
From hospital admission to hospital discharge or 90 days
From randomisation to 28 days after randomisation
From randomisation to 90 days after randomisation
From randomisation to discharge from ICU or death/palliative discharge from it or 90 days
From randomisation to discharge from ICU or death/palliative discharge from it or 90 days

other_outcome.measure: Grade 3 &4 adverse events relating to endotracheal cuff pressure

arm_group.description: Continuous endotracheal cuff pressure control using Tracoe cuff pressure controller during their intubated stay on ICU.
Intermittent cuff pressure control through manual measurement performed 3 times per day (standard care)

intervention.description: Participant will be attached to the cuff pressure controller as soon as possible after enrolment. They will remain attached during their intubated stay. If reintubated during same admission they will continue in the intervention arm. If readmitted to ICU they will be managed according to standard care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- About to be intubated or intubated for ≤ 24 hours (either oral or tracheostomy)
- For active treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- previously enrolled in this study
- previously intubated within 14 days
- suffering from known tracheomalacia, tracheal stenosis or stridor relating to tracheal injury
